## Introduction

2025 has been a year of many small progress and firsts for me. First package submission to [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/){target="_blank"}. First time attending [R Dev Day](https://contributor.r-project.org/events/r-dev-days/){target="_blank"}. First submission to the [Posit Table Contest](https://posit.co/blog/announcing-the-2025-table-and-plotnine-contests/){target="_blank"}.<br><br>As the year comes to an end, it is time to acknowledge and celebrate these little achievements and milestones in my life.<br><br><a href="#top">Back
to top</a> @cr-introduction

## R package pretestcad

Since I joined National Heart Centre Singapore a few years ago, I had been working on an R package that consolidates different pretest probability scores for coronary artery disease into one library.<br><br>This R package is subsequently known as [`pretestcad`](https://jauntyjjs.github.io/pretestcad/){target="_blank"}.<br><br>This year, I managed to make this R package publicly [available on CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/pretestcad/index.html){target="_blank"} and [RUniverse](https://jauntyjjs.r-universe.dev/pretestcad){target="_blank"}. @cr-pretestcad-cran

I was also given a chance to present this R package in various conferences such as [R/Medicine](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5hpTlmKvRU8){target="_blank"} and [R/Pharma](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=008bBfihSwM){target="_blank"} and gave out some hex stickers during the [useR! 2025](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jw9AqrhA2lM){target="_blank"} conference.<br><br>![](images/pretestcad_stickers.jpg){fig-alt="R package pretestcad hex stickers." fig-align="center" width="80%"}<br><br><a href="#top">Back
to top</a> @cr-userR-2025-pretestcad

## End of Reservist Cycle

It was close to around nine years since I had started my reservist duty with 6th Signals Battalion. Time really flies and this year marks my last training in my reservist cycle. <br><br>Here is a picture of me together with my officer and those who have completed their reservist cycle in my node (N67) with me. @cr-mr-picture 

Every reservist training, I try to make an effort to give those at their last reservist training a small gift (sponsored by my officer) and a farewell card containing messages written by each member of the group.<br><br>This time, I have decided to make these farewell cards by myself and give them my best wishes to them. Here is a picture of some farewell cards that I have made for everyone in my node (N67).<br><br>I will definitely miss the people that I have met over the past few years and I wish them well in their future endeavours.<br><br><a href="#top">Back
to top</a> @cr-mr-cards

## R Dev Day after useR! 2025

During the [R Dev Day](https://contributor.r-project.org/events/r-dev-days/){target="_blank"} session after the useR! 2025 conference, I was placed in a group with [Shannon](https://www.pipinghotdata.com/){target="_blank"} and [Eliot](https://www.linkedin.com/in/eliot-dixon-a36b22188/) to create some test (rotated and oriented) images that facilitate a [bug report](https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=17148){target="_blank"} showing some unexpected image outputs when the R function [`rasterImage`](https://search.r-project.org/R/refmans/graphics/html/rasterImage.html){target="_blank"} was used to display on various devices (Cario, Quartz, Xlib and windows). @cr-r-dev-day-square

Initially, I thought we wouldn't be contributing much as Eliot and I were first timers in this event. Nevertheless, we managed to produce the requested images and relevant outputs in this [GitHub issue](https://github.com/r-devel/r-dev-day/issues/75){target="_blank"}.<br><br> I actually had a lot of fun trying to make these images in base R.<br><br><a href="#top">Back
to top</a> @cr-r-dev-day-f

::: cr-section
## Reflections

:::{focus-on="cr-fear"}

I had to admit that these firsts were scary and I did have many self doubts.<br><br>

![Output from [M365 Copilot](https://gemini.google.com/){target="_blank"} using prompt "Create a blackboard with the abbreviation saying FEAR: False Evidence Appearing Real."](images/fear.png){fig-alt="Blackboard with the abbreviation saying FEAR: False Evidence Appearing Real." fig-align="center"width="80%"}

:::

However, based on my [reflections last year](https://jauntyjjs.github.io/reflection_2024/){target="_blank"}, I was reminded that there are people out there who would be interested in the work that I do, appreciate my talents and accept my shortcoming. @cr-self-love

I began to realise that these firsts were actually opportunities given by God for me to improve myself by having more self love and courage to get up of my comfort zone.<br><br>As I took the leap of faith and tried something different or new, I realised that things were not as bad as I thought and I ended up benefiting myself and others more instead (based on my achievements this year). @cr-opportunities

Opportunities are always around but it can also be easily be seen as obstacles.<br><br>As fallible humans, it is normal to be fearful sometimes to push beyond our current boundaries, not knowing what lies ahead. When that happens, I remember a kind soul advising me to focus on all the reasons why I should carry on rather than gathering worries and excuses not to take the next step.<br><br>If things get too overwhelming, it is fine to pause and take things one step at a time. It is better to take things slow and steady than to stop and turn back. @cr-journey

I don't know what 2026 will bring but I strongly believe that God has a beuatiful plan for me and you and hope is always on your side.<br><br>Indeed, each of us has the essential potential to do great things that can benefit our everyday lives. I hope that through this simple reflection, you will be motivated to pick yourself up and keep moving towards your inner desire and calling.<br><br>Wishing you all the very best in your journey.<br><br><a href="#top">Back
to top</a> @cr-essential    

::: {#cr-fear .scale-to-fill}

## Meta Information

Soruce code can be found in this [Github Page `r fontawesome::fa(name = "github", fill = "#000000")`](https://github.com/JauntyJJS/reflection_2025){target="_blank"}

Here are the R packages used.

```{r}
#| label: R Package Used
#| title: "ðŸ“¦ R Packages Used"

get_r_package_info <- function() {

  r_package_table <- sessioninfo::package_info()
  rownames(r_package_table) <- NULL

  r_package_table <- r_package_table |>
    tibble::as_tibble() |>
    dplyr::mutate(
      version = ifelse(is.na(r_package_table$loadedversion),
                       r_package_table$ondiskversion,
                       r_package_table$loadedversion)) |>
    dplyr::filter(.data[["attached"]] == TRUE) |>
    dplyr::select(
      dplyr::any_of(c("package", "version",
                      "date", "source"))
    )

  return(r_package_table)

}

get_r_package_info() |>
  reactable::reactable(
    defaultPageSize = 5,
    paginationType = "jump",
  )

```

Here is the R session used to generate this webpage.

```{r}
#| label: R Session Info
#| warning: false
#| title: "ðŸ’» R Session Info"

get_quarto_version <- function(
    test_sys_path = FALSE,
    test_no_path = FALSE
) {

  # Taken from https://github.com/r-lib/sessioninfo/issues/75
  if (isNamespaceLoaded("quarto") && isFALSE(test_sys_path)) {
    path <- quarto::quarto_path() |>
      fs::path_real()
    ver <- system("quarto -V", intern = TRUE)
    if (is.null(path) || isTRUE(test_no_path)) {
      "NA (via quarto)"
    } else {
      paste0(ver, " @ ", path, "/ (via quarto)")
    }
  } else {
    path <- Sys.which("quarto") |>
      fs::path_real()
    if (path == "" || isTRUE(test_no_path)) {
      "NA"
    } else {
      ver <- system("quarto -V", intern = TRUE)
      paste0(ver, " @ ", path)
    }
  }
}


get_knitr_version <- function() {

  knitr_info <- "NA"

  r_package_table <- sessioninfo::package_info(
    pkgs = c("installed")
  ) |>
    dplyr::filter(.data[["package"]] == "knitr")

  if (nrow(r_package_table) == 1) {

    knitr_version <- r_package_table$loadedversion[1]
    knitr_source <- r_package_table$source[1]

    knitr_info <- paste0(
      knitr_version, " from ",
      knitr_source)
  }

  return(knitr_info)

}

get_r_platform_info <- function() {

  r_platform_table <- sessioninfo::platform_info()
  r_platform_table[["quarto"]] <- get_quarto_version()[1]
  r_platform_table[["knitr"]] <- get_knitr_version()[1]

  r_platform_table <- data.frame(
    setting = names(r_platform_table),
    value = unlist(r_platform_table,
                   use.names = FALSE),
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE
  )

  return(r_platform_table)
}

r_platform_table <- get_r_platform_info()

r_platform_table |>
  reactable::reactable(
    defaultPageSize = 5,
    paginationType = "jump",
  )


```
